Title: For $n \geq 2$, show that $n \nmid 2^{n}-1$
Content: Here is a problem which i have not been able to do for quite sometime. For $n \geq 2$, show that $n \nmid 2^{n}-1$. I have thought of proving this in two ways: One by using induction which didn't actually work. Next by Fermat's little theorem we have $2^{p-1} \equiv 1 \ (\text{mod} \ p)$, which actually says that for $p \mid 2^{p}-2$. But i couldn't proceed more than this. Any ideas by which i can actually solve the problem?
